hero.title: PH fishers’ cry: Freedom to fish in our country’s waters, not ‘ayuda’
hero.description: Manila, Philippines-“Para [kaming] magnanakaw [sa sarili naming bayan].”

primary.lead: VP Duterte's Resignation from Department of Education
primary.title: [In This Economy] Duterte exits DepEd: Good riddance!
primary.description: Who will replace Duterte? It better be someone good – for the sake of our kids and this country

secondary.title: Duterte resigns from Marcos Cabinet
secondary.description: Vice President Sara Duterte has resigned as a member of the Cabinet of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. In a statement on Wednesday, June 19, 2024, the Presidential Communications Office (PCO) announced Duterte’s resignation as secretary of the Department of Education (DepEd)

secondary.title: Sara Duterte resigns as DepEd secretary
secondary.description: Vice President Sara Duterte has tendered her resignation as Department of Education secretary, dislodging herself from President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s Cabinet after a tense year of flaring political tensions between both of their families.

secondary.title: Sara Duterte resigns from Marcos Cabinet
secondary.description: Vice President Sara Duterte has resigned from the Cabinet of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr, the Palace said on Wednesday.

carousel.title: PH students second to last in creative thinking — PISA
carousel.description: Filipino students ranked second to the last when it comes to creative thinking, according on a newly released report of the Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA).

carousel.title: Pentagon Ran a Secret Anti-Vax Campaign to Undermine China at the Height of the Pandemic: Reuters
carousel.description: The U.S. military ran a secret anti-vaccination campaign at the height of the pandemic in the Philippines and other nations to sow doubt about COVID vaccines made by China, according to a  new investigation by Reuters.

carousel.title: Chinese coast guard clashes with Philippines Navy boats
carousel.description: The Philippines says its soldiers were attacked with swords, spears and knives in the South China Sea.

carousel.title: President Marcos Jr. hasn't put an end to killings in the Philippines' drug war
carousel.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marco Jr. said he would turn his predecessor's deadly campaign against drug users and sellers "bloodless." Yet extrajudicial killings continue.
